subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re:Greetings
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
I just let whatever/whoever talk. Using the echo chamber seems to allow ETs
more consistently, especially if it's aluminum, I don't know why. The echo
chamber is just an enclosed area with a speaker on one end where the box
audio is fed, and a mic on the other end.

 There seems to be multiple levels, and some kind of propagation conditions
similar to shortwave radio that allows various levels to come through.

 F-S

On Sat, Jun 5, 2010 at 8:54 AM, draiga1 <blackwing@...> wrote:

>
>
> That in itself is fascinating. I wonder how we can tune in to specific
> types of beings? For instance if you wanted a session with ETs?
>
> Don't get me wrong, I LOVE hearing from ghosts too.
>
> ~Draiga
>
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> >
> > Poser==spirit mimics=darkside deception. There seems to be a level that
> > wants the fact of an after life kept hidden from humanity. The ET guys
> claim
> > I'm one fof theirs, and when I get these bogus dates they break in and
> say
> > "We told you--Christmas!!"--December 2012.
> >
> > It's like the whole freaking universe comes through these methods, not
> just
> > the dead.
> >
> > F-S
> >
> > On Fri, Jun 4, 2010 at 10:45 AM, tim_woolworth <tim@...> wrote:
> >
> > >
> > >
> > > Sorry 'bout your hearing. Lost a bit 'o mine too. I was a professional
> > > audio engineer for 8 years and I was in a band for a few years. I
> certainly
> > > don't hear like I used to.
> > >
> > > I think that it's hilarious you call some of your voices 'posers.' Why
> do
> > > you call them posers? I've only been doing this for a fraction of the
> time
> > > that you have been doing this so I am curious. I am still amazed when
> any
> > > voice comes through, even if they are negative (which does happen very
> > > rarely). And how can you tell when you have ET's communicating? Do they
> > > sound different or say different types of things?
> > >
> > > Tim
> > >
>  > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> <EVP-ITC%
> 40yahoogroups.com>, Frank Sumption
> > > <purplealiengirl@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Most of the time I'm so busy building the junk I don't take time to
> > > > actually use it. My right ear has about 1/4 the sensitvity of the
> left
> > > ear,
> > > > maybe less, I miss alot. Some of these voices are my ET guys and some
> are
> > > > posers that confuse everything.
> > > >
> > > > f-S
> > > >
> > > > On Thu, Jun 3, 2010 at 5:01 PM, tim_woolworth <tim@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > > Frank,
> > > > >
> > > > > Yeah, you do get them talking about you. It seems like there is a
> lot
> > > of
> > > > > conversation between many voices here and they are talking about
> > > calling. At
> > > > > .08, somebody is tee'd off.
> > > > >
> > > > > There is something to labeling affecting subliminal interpretation.
> > > When I
> > > > > read your interpretation of the "jesus" line at the beginning, that
> is
> > > what
> > > > > I heard through the speakers first and foremost. I turned the
> speakers
> > > off
> > > > > and used studio grade headphones for analysis. Voila, no Jesus. I
> guess
> > > he
> > > > > was resurrected from this clip! I often wonder if the sound waves
> > > between
> > > > > speaker and listener are manipulated in some way. This is why I
> like to
> > > > > listen in enclosed headphones, that way your ear is directly
> against
> > > the
> > > > > sound source.
> > > > >
> > > > > That said, this is what I hear from your clip:
> > > > >
> > > > > @.01: "He's calling you, he's a (unclear)" (male, electronic)
> > > > > @.03: It amounts to scheisse
> > > > > @.05: "Make sure he has the date" (male)
> > > > > @.06: "May Eighteenth" (electronic)
> > > > > @.08: "Fuck this guy" (male)
> > > > > @.09: Singing - "He doesn't call her, call her (?anymore?)"
> (female)
> > > > > @.12: He doesn't seem to reply (male)
> > > > > @.13: Steve (?Coogle? - unclear)
> > > > >
> > > > > I know you typically don't interact with the box by asking
> questions,
> > > but
> > > > > have you ever tried telling them to communicate one at a time? It
> works
> > > for
> > > > > me most of the time when multiple voices crowd the box. Regardless,
> > > they
> > > > > definitely like communicating with you. I find the electronic
> voices
> > > and
> > > > > tones you get most interesting; they remind me of spiricom audio.
> > > > >
> > > > > Tim

> > > > > the

> some
> > > of
> > > > > those
> > > > > > >> clips, you can definitely hear them talking amongst
> themselves.
> > > > > > >>
> > > > > > >> The main voice you hear (especially in clip 4) is my
> technician,
> > > or as
> > > > > I
> > > > > > >> call him, my facilitator. He is the one telling Raudive to ask
> his
> > > > > question
> > > > > > >> and telling an Other to wait. I have numerous clips where I
> will
> > > ask a
> > > > > > >> question and I can hear him ask the same question of the
> Others.
> > > This
> > > > > is all
> > > > > > >> the personal proof I need (besides my name and facts about my
> life
> > > > > coming
> > > > > > >> through a broken radio). To hear your own words coming through
> the
> > > > > radio in
> > > > > > >> a different voice is something that should be considered
> > > > > impossible...but
> > > > > > >> then to get an answer back from those reiterated words, well,
> I
> > > > > consider
> > > > > > >> that pretty damn good evidence that there is an intelligence
> > > trying to
> > > > > > >> communicate.
> > > > > > >>
> > > > > > >> But then again, any scientist can easily say that I was
> > > experiencing
> > > > > > >> nothing more that a Ham radio operator having fun at my
> expense.
> > > My
> > > > > only
> > > > > > >> come back to this is that since I still a ghost hunter, I have
> > > > > traveled
> > > > > > >> extensively to different locations. I have been bringing my
> box
> > > out in
> > > > > to
> > > > > > >> the field for location experiments. Guess what? My facilitator
> > > speaks
> > > > > in
> > > > > > >> every spot, in every state that I have tried this in.
> > > > > > >>
> > > > > > >> Tim
